```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(projoint)
```

## 📥 Read Your Data

Before reshaping or analyzing your conjoint survey data, you first need to **import it into R**.  In **projoint**, use the `read_Qualtrics()` function to quickly read properly formatted Qualtrics files.

---

## 🚀 Quick Workflow

<summary><b>Export your survey responses from Qualtrics</b></summary>

When exporting from Qualtrics:

- Click **"Download Data"**.
- Choose **CSV** format.
- Critically, select **"Use choice text"** instead of coded values.

⚡ If you skip "Use choice text," your conjoint data may not load properly!

<summary><b>Load essential packages</b></summary>

```{r, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(projoint)
```

<summary><b>Read your CSV file into R using `read_Qualtrics()`</b></summary>

```r
# Example: If your file is located in a "data" folder
data <- read_Qualtrics("data/your_file.csv")
```
Or, if using an example bundled with **projoint**:

```{r, eval=TRUE, echo=FALSE}
data <- read_Qualtrics(
  system.file("extdata", "mummolo_nall_replication.csv", package = "projoint")
)
```

```{r}
data
```
